loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is an industrious mother who is engaged in a hog-raising business. She is now 44 years old and has three children.  She wants to have higher sales after four months, but financial difficulty hampers her to buy the necessities for her hogs. As a result, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, medicine and vitamins. She hopes that by providing the necessities for her pigs, she will gain higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vitamins

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past six, Janet has been working hard to manage her retail store where she sells sugar, flour, rice and other items. 

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sugar, flour, rice and other items and will help Janet to generate greater profits and expand the business. Janet hopes that in the future, she will be able to add more money to the business. 

Janet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Janet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to stock more sugar, flour, rice and other items

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has an entertainment videoke business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food making.  Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional unit of videoke machine for her entertainment videoke business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit of videoke machine

loans.name: Ambrocio

texts.en:
This is Ambrocio, 53, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. He is married to Sarah, his business partner, and they have children. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ambrocio oversees operations of their Jeepney transportation business. They have one unit of Jeep that carries up to 16 passengers to their destination within the community; He earns from the boundary (daily quota) their driver remits everyday. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will be using the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. 

Ambrocio hopes to have more jeepneys and dreams of being more successful in life by the grace of God. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 30 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She manages a general store. She is thankful because she has been earning PHP 300 each day, which she is using for their daily commodities. She is aiming for a higher income in order to save for the education of her children. To make her source of income more profitable, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase canned goods, biscuits, milk, sugar and bath soap. Hopefully, the loan will be a great help in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, biscuits, milk, sugar and bath soap

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 49 years old and married with six children.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional trays of eggs to sell.

Milagros has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling eggs business for 10 years and earns additional income from raising pigs, ducks and chickens.

Milagros aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Junia

texts.en: Junia is a hard working mother who is engaged in buying and selling charcoal in the community to help her husband in generating income. She is now 32 years old and has three school-age children. She aims to strengthen her business and make it viable source of income. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of charcoal to sell. She believes that her loan will be a great help to her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
This is Benilda. She previously accessed a15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Benilda hopes to expand her business and dreams of having her house renovated. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Imara Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kanyere est leader du groupe Imara, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 44 ans et mère de 12  enfants, parmi les quels 8 etudient. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Etat. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires (tomates, patates, bananes, etc.). Elle installe ses produits dans un petit dépôt. Elle commença avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 22 cycles de crédits dans le projet Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’augmenter son stock (tomates, bananes, arachides, patates, fruits, etc.). Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise et scolariser ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro credit sans aucune garentie materielle.
texts.en:
The borrower, Kanyere, is the leader of the Imara group.  She is a 44-year-old dynamic entrepreneur and the mother of 12 children, eight of whom attend school.  Her husband is a government employee.

Kanyere sells food products (tomatoes, potatoes, bananas etc.)  She displays her goods in a small food stall.  She started in this business with a loan taken with the microfinance institution Hekima and has already completed 22 loan cycles with them. With her new loan, she will increase her stock of goods and buy some tomatoes, bananas, groundnut, potatoes, fruits etc.  In doing so, she wishes to expand her business and educate her children.

Kanyere thanks Hekima for its support.  She is also requesting that they review their repayment schedule (weekly repayment instead of monthly repayment).

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods (tomatoes, bananas, groundnuts, potatoes, fruits etc...)

loans.name: Cruz Inocencio

texts.es: Cruz de 66 años de edad vive en  el municipio de Sabanalarga, municipio ganadero y de habitantes muy inteligentes y por ello los oriundos de esta población cuando le preguntan su origen dicen: ”de Sabanalarga donde la Inteligencia es peste”  Cruz desde hace 10 años se dedica a vender bolsas de agua, mediante el sistema de distribución directa,  actividad comercial que aprendió cuando trabajó con una empresa que realizaba esa misma actividad y tomó mucha experiencia, la cual lo llevó a  independizarse y emprendió su propia aventura de negocios. Hoy realiza ventas de contado a comerciante y hace sus compras en un municipio muy cercano donde las producen. En la actualidad su clientela ha crecido y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para aumentar sus compras y vender un poco mas, esta es la razón por la cual acude aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará agua en mayor volumen obteniendo así mayores descuentos y generando una mayor utilidad que beneficiará los ingresos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Cruz, 66, lives in Sabanalarga, a livestock farming municipality with very intelligent inhabitants.  When asked where they are from, they say: "from Sabanalarga, where intelligence is a plague".  For ten years, Cruz has been selling bags of water through direct distribution.  He learned his trade from a company where he worked and gained much experience, which prompted him to become independent and establish his own business.  He buys the water close to where it is produced and sells it on a cash basis to merchants.

His clientele has grown but he does not have enough capital to increase his purchases to sell more.  Therefore, he is requesting a crediKiva loan, which is his first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  The will allow him to buy more water and obtain larger discounts.  The increase in profit will give his family more income.

loans.use: To buy more water.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.es: Eddie de 30 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo a 15 minutos de la ciudad, pues es área metropolitana de Barranquilla. Allí tiene un negocio de variedades, en un punto ubicado en sus propia casa, donde exhibe y vende artículos de tocador, útiles de papelería, accesorios femeninos, ropa y otras mercancías, que vende de contado, una vez las compra a proveedores que le ofrecen los mejores descuentos. Su meta es mejorar la imagen de su negocio y exhibir mejor sus productos, por ello ha acudido a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina y accesorios femeninos, artículos  para el hogar, sandalias etc con lo cual tendrá un inventario bien exhibido y atraerá mas clientes, lo que impactará sus ventas y  hará de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Eddie, 30, lives in Malambo, about 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  She has a variety store set up in her home, where she displays and sells toiletry products, stationery goods, women's accessories, clothing and other merchandise.  She buys from suppliers who give her good discounts and sells on a cash basis.  Her goal is to improve the image of her business and display her products better.  Therefore, she is requesting a crediKiva loan so she can buy a display case and women's accessories, household products, sandals, etc. to attract more customers.  This will increase sales and make the crediKiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: To buy a display case and women's accessories, household products and sandals.

loans.name: Normelina

texts.es:
Normelina tiene 29 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en un aldea de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Normelina  tiene un negocio de pulpería lleva 5 años trabajando en el, inicio con la necesidad de un ingreso y un empleo fijo. Utilizo fondos propios para surtir el negocio. Normelina dedica tiempo completo a la pulpería.  Vende arroz, manteca, frijoles, maíz, harina, azúcar, entre otras cosas.
Solicito este crédito de 10,000 lempiras para surtir su inventario con la compra de frijoles, maíz, azúcar, arroz, harina etc.
Su meta es que el negocio crezca y poder extenderse con la venta de otros productos.
texts.en:
Normelina, 29, is married, has two children and lives in the village of Taulabe, Comayagua.  For five years, she has been running a grocery store which she started because she needed a job to earn an income.  She used her own capital to stock the store where she works full-time.  She sells rice, shortening, beans, corn, flour, sugar and other items.

She has requested this 10,000 HNL loan to buy beans, corn, sugar, rice, flour, etc.  Her goal is to expand her business and begin selling other products.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store, such as flour, beans, rice, softdrinks, corn, etc.

loans.name: Grenik

texts.ru:
Греник родился в городе Капан. Сейчас он вместе с женой живет в селе Нор Араджадзор(Nor Arajadzor) неподалеку от города Капан. Ему 67 и он счастливый дедушка -пенсионер.У Греника сын и дочь у которых уже свои собственные семья. 
 Несмотря на возраст Греник не представляет себя без любимой работы. Греник окончил Профтехучилище по специальности механик.После учебы он до сех пор работает как тракторист-механик и очень популярный в этой области специалист. У Греника есть собственный  трактор с помощью которого он зарабатывает на хлеб. 
Жена Греника занимается их огородом и рогатым скотом . А он с утра до позднего вечера со своим трактором  работает на земельных участках односельчан . Так же у Греника есть большой участок земли где он выращивает пшеницу и ячмень. 
Несмотря на тяжелую работу Греник очень счастлив, что в зрелом возрасте способен позаботиться о своей семье без помощи детей и гордится тем, что иногда он помогает своим детям по их хозяйству. 
Трактор Греника уже старый и нуждается в капитальном ремонте. Уже весна и у Греника много заказов . Он спешит во время отремонтировать трактор для весенних посевных работ. 
Греник просит кредит от Кива на сумму 800,000 Армянских драм для покупки запасных частей его сельскохозяйственной техники и для капитального ремонта трактора.
texts.en:
Grenik was born in the city of Kapan. Presently, he and his wife live in the village of Nor Arajadzor, near Kapan. Grenik is 67 years old, a pensioner, and a happy grandfather. He has a son and a daughter, who already have their own families.

Despite his age, Grenik cannot imagine his life without his favourite work. He graduated from a technical college as a mechanic. He has been working as a tractor operator/mechanic since then, and his services are in great demand. Grenik has his own tractor, which he uses to earn a living. While his wife works in their garden and takes care of their livestock, Grenik uses his tractor to work their neighbours' fields from morning til night. Grenik also has his own plot of land where he cultivates wheat and barley.

Despite the hard work, Grenik is glad to be able to take care of his family without the help of his children, despite his advanced years, and takes pride in the fact that he occasionally gives his children a hand with their household chores.

Grenik's tractor is very old and needs a major overhaul. It is already spring, and Grenik has many work orders. He is in a hurry to repair his tractor in time for the spring sowing. Grenik is requesting a Kiva loan of 800,000 Armenian dram to purchase spare parts for his agricultural equipment and to carry out major repairs on his tractor.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his agricultural machinery and to repair his tractor

loans.name: Henzel

texts.ru:
Гензелу 59 года, он вдовец. Жена Гензела умерла год назад и он теперь живет один в селе Срашен Сюникской области. По домашнему хозяйству ему помагает единственая дочь которая замужем и живет с семьей отдельно. 
По специальности Гензел тракторист механик. Сейчас Гензел работает в сельском муниципалитете и очень любит свою работу. Кроме работы он занимается сельскохозяйством в родном селе. Выращивает в основном овощи: помидор,огурцы, картошку, перец и бакладжан. Он так же имеет корову и кур , молоко, сыр и яйца для ежедневного использования он получает от своих животных. У него есть и небольшой земельный участок который рассположен  неподолеку от его дома где сеет пщеницу и получает муку , что ему хватает на весь год. 
Гензел просит от кредиторов Кива кредит на сумму 400,000 Армянских драм для покупки семян на весенний посев.
texts.en:
Henzel is a 59-year-old widower. His wife passed away a year ago, and now he lives alone in the village of Srashen in the Syunik province. Around the house, he is helped by his only daughter, who is married and lives with her family separately from her father. 

Henzel is a tractor operator/mechanic by training. Presently, he works for his village's municipal office and loves his work. In addition, he is engaged in agriculture in his native village, growing mainly vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, peppers and eggplant. Henzel also keeps a cow and chickens, who provide him with his daily milk, cheese and eggs. Finally, he has a small plot of land near his home where he sows wheat for producing his annual supply of flour.

Henzel is asking Kiva lenders for a loan of 400,000 Armenian dram to purchase seeds for the spring planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds for the spring planting

loans.name: Noe

texts.es: Noe tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en la casa rústica que le fue heredado de sus padres.  Proviene de una zona rural donde se dedican a las actividades agrícolas, cada fin de semana  viaja a la ciudad para vender los animales de ganado vacuno y ovino que cría con mucha dedicación, pues según afirma el precio de venta depende mucho de la calidad. En la  feria ganadera de la ciudad las cuales se realizan los días domingos, es donde obtiene la mayor parte de sus ganancias, ya que tiene que aprovechar la acogida de las personas que viajan de diversas ciudades del país para comprar ganado; su hermana es la persona que lo apoya en estas actividades. Confiesa que la venta de ganado le ofrece mayor ingreso económico por lo que desea en el futuro dedicarse a tiempo completo a esta labor, además de criar más animales. Este es el segundo préstamo con KIVA , por lo cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas . Noe, invertirá los S/. 3000 soles  en la compra de más ganado, especialmente un toro de buena raza.
texts.en:
Noe, 36, lives with his wife and children in a rustic house he inherited from his parents.  He is a farmer in the rural area and travels every weekend to the city to sell his cattle and sheep.  He is very dedicated to caring for the animals since their sale price depends a lot on quality.  He obtains most of his profit from the Sunday livestock market held in the city because many people from all over the country travel their to make their purchases.  His sister helps with the business.

He says selling livestock offers a good income, so in the future he would like to work at it full time and raise more animals.  This is his second KIVA loan and he is committed to paying it back on time.  Noe will use the 3,000 PEN to buy more cattle, especially a purebred bull.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es: Madeleine de 31 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana    de la ciudad de Barranquilla, ella tiene un negocio familiar donde ofrece servicios de soldadura, en un pequeño taller ubicado en su domicilio y allí mismo vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 4 años. Su idea de negocio nació hace 2 años, contando con uno de sus hermanos, que es experto en el tema de soldadura de estructuras y por eso se unió a el para emprender su propia aventura conjunta . Hoy Sus metas de crecimiento son superiores a su capacidad de crecer, ellos solos sin apoyos financieros y por eso Madeleine acude  a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos como hierro, para elaborar estructuras, en un mayor volumen y así responder a su demanda y crecer un poco mas. Su meta mas adelante es hacer adecuaciones a su local y aumentar sus posibilidades de financiamiento, haciendo que  sus inversiones tengan éxito.
texts.en:
Madeleine, 31, lives in Malambo, an urban area of the city of Barranquilla.  She runs a family business offering welding services from a workshop set up in her home, where she lives with her husband and two children, ages 11 and 4.  She came up with the idea for the business two years ago, and was able to count on her brother who is an expert welder.  They set up a joint venture.

For now, business expansion goals are larger than growing capacity and there is no financial support.  So Madeline is requesting a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy more iron to make metal structures to be in a position to fill orders and grow a little.  Her goal is to renovate her workshop and increase financing possibilities so her investments will be successful.

loans.use: To buy iron to make metal structures.

loans.name: Armenak

texts.ru:
С 2000 года Арменак занимается сельскохазяйственной деятельностью на своем участке земли в Капане.  Арменак сам построил полиэтиленовую теплицу и там выращивает зелень;петрушку,редиску,киндзу и лук. Круглый год он продает свежий зелень на рынках Капана . Иногда оптовые покупщики покупают зелень у Арменака прямо с его теплицы. 
Арменак считает что выращивание овощей и зелени в теплице очень выгодным сельским бизнесом, потому что прибыль от этой деятельности намного больше. Но ухаживать за теплицей очень трудная и тяжелая работа, и как он признался просто надо делать свою работу с любовью чтобы урожай был хорошим. Арменак все время читает разную литературу про теплиц и мечтает построить большую теплицу по новейшей технологии с системой капельного орошения и с новейшей системой отопления,но пока для этого ему нехватает средств и достаточно знаний. 
Арменак живет вместе с женой , сыном и дочерью в городе Капан. Его жена библиотекарь и свободное от работы время помогает мужу в теплице и помогает ухаживать за коровами и курами. 
 У Арменака высшее инженерское образование но так как в капане невозможно работать по специальности,  он предпочитает сельскохозяйственную деятельность.  
Арменаку нужен кредит для покупки полиэтиленового покрытия для его теплицы и корма для кур и коров.
texts.en:
Since 2000, Armenak has been engaged in agriculture on his plot of land in Kapan. With his own hands, he has built a plastic-covered greenhouse where he grows herbs and vegetables such as parsley, radishes, coriander and onions. He sells fresh herbs year round at Kapan's markets, whereas sometimes bulk purchasers buy his herbs directly from his greenhouse. Armenak considers greenhouse cultivation of vegetables and herbs to be a very profitable agricultural activity as the profits far exceed the investment. That said, taking care of the greenhouse is hard work, and Armenak admits that it is necessary for him to love his work to get a good harvest. He constantly reads various technical literature about greenhouses and dreams of constructing a large technologically advanced greenhouse, with drip irrigation and a modern heating system, but currently lacks the funds and technical know-how to make this happen.

Armenak lives in the city of Kapan together with his wife, son and daughter. His wife is a librarian, and in her spare time she gives her husband a hand in the greenhouse and also helps him take care of their cows and chickens. Armenak has post-secondary education as an engineer, but since there are no jobs available for him in Kapan, he prefers to work in agriculture.

Armenak needs a loan to purchase plastic film covering for his greenhouse, as well as fodder for his chickens and cows.

loans.use: to buy plastic covering for his greenhouse and fodder for his chickens and cows

loans.name: Nong Taaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme SYLVIE est responsable du groupe NONG-TAABA.  Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgés à 08 ans.  02 vont à l’école  et  elle a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mme  vend des habits depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les femmes de son quartier. 
Elle veut s’acheter 04 douzaines d’habits. 
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de s’acheter une moto. Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sylvie is the leader of Nong Taaba Group. She's married and the mother of two children. The eldest is eleven years old, the youngest is eight. Both of them attend school. In addition, she has two dependents.

Mrs. Sylvie has been selling clothing for five years. She gets her supplies from a market in her area. Her customers are women of her neighborhood.

She wants to buy four dozen pieces of clothing. She wants to put away her profits in order to purchase a motorcycle.

She ambitions to expand her business and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy four dozen pieces of clothing

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old and has a wife and two children, a two-year-old and a one-year-old.

Richard's timber business did well after the first loan, and he is now applying for his second loan from KADET LTD to help him buy more stocks of timber to sell and buy a motorbike. 

He hopes to open a timber yard in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of timber to sell and to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анне скоро будет 20. Она живет вместе с родителями и сестрой в городе Капан. Сестра Анны студентка, отец работает на стройке рабочим. Мать Анны уже долгие годы занимается перепродажей одежды в Капане. Так как содержать большую семью в маленьком городке Капан очень трудно , Анна в 2012 году решила сама попробовать занятся бизнесом. Уже год как Анна арендует лавочку в Капанской ярмарке и продает женскую одежду. До открытия собственного бизнеса Анна помогала матери в ее лавочке и хорошо знает трудности этого бизнеса. У нее уже есть постоянные клиенты не толька с Капана , но и из соседних поселков . Секрет удачи Анны в торговле одежды состоит в том что она молодая и хорошо понимает и представляет все тенденции в моде и у нее всегда новыие партии одежды которые она каждый месяц покупает и привозит в Капан из оптовых рынках Еревана. 
С прибылью от торговли Анна помогает родителям в содержании семьи и помогает сестре по оплате ее учебы. 
Анна нуждается в кредите на сумму 2700 Американских долларов для покупки новой партии одежды весеннего и летнего  сезона из Еревана  , для перепродажи в своей лавочке .
texts.en:
Anna will soon be twenty years old. She lives with her parents and sister in Kapan. Her sister is a student. Her father does construction work and her mother has worked in clothing sales for many years now. 

As it is difficult to support a large family in a small town like Kapan, in 2012 Anna decided to try her hand at business. She has been renting a stall and selling women's clothing at the Kapan fair for a year now. Before opening her own business Anna helped her mother in her stall and hence knows well the difficulties of the business. She already has regular clients not only in Kapan, but also in nearby villages. The secret to her success is that she is young and understands fashion trends well. She brings new clothing to Kapan from wholesale markets in Yerevan every month. 

Anna uses the profit from her business to help her parents support the family and her sister pay for school. Anna needs a loan of 2700 Armenian dollars to purchase spring and summer clothing in Yerevan for her stall in Kapan.

loans.use: To buy a new women clothes assortment for spring and summer seasons from Yerevan wholesale markets for reselling them in her stall in Kapan

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans les familles monogames, les quatre femmes du groupe Badenya ont en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Chiola dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales et d’arachide. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djènèba (la deuxième femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des arachides dans le village. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 sacs d’arachides. Elle se ravitaille en arachide à la foire de Konodimini. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et dans le marché Medine Ségou à une clientèle mixte. Madame Djènèba  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer la consommation familiale du foyer en condiments. A l’instar des autres femmes du groupe, Madame  Djènèba a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four members of Badenya Group are for the most part married women who live in monogamous families. They average 38 years of age and three children.

They all live in Chiola, a village in Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of Mali), and got acquainted through business and bonds of neighborhood.

They retail cereals and peanuts. In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their sixth group loan.

Mrs. Djènèba (second woman from the left in the photograph) has a good reputation as a peanuts merchant in her village.

She intends to use her part of the loan to buy 20 sacks of peanuts. She gets her supplies from the fair in Konodimini.

She resells for cash and on credit, at her home and at the Medine market in Ségou, to a clientele comprising both men and women. 

With this loan, she hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30), to be reinvested in her business and used to ensure the daily food expenses of her family get covered. 

Mrs. Djènèba's goal, which all members of the group share, is to expand her business, thanks to this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Smbat

texts.ru:
Смбату  53 лет,родился в  городе Капан .Он проживает вместе с женой , тремья сыновьями и с матерью в Капане. Все сыновя Смбата работают и помогают родителям по содержанию их большой и дружной семьи. 
Основная деятельность Смбата это сельское хозяйство, в котором заняты все члены его семьи. У них есть большой огород рядом с домом где выращивают овощи .Так как климат в Капане очень благополучный , у Смбата в огороде можно найти все разновидности овощей. А в саду у них даже растут цитрусовые культуры. 
Смбат так -же занимается скотоводством , у него 5 коров , бычок и лошадь. А жена Смбата ухаживает за курами и индейками. Смбат с семьей реализует свою сельскохозяйственную продукцию на продуктовых рынках Капана и Каджарана.
Кроме всего Смбат еще и творческая личность, он скульптор. У него дома есть маленькая мастерская где он изготовляет из глины и гипса различные статуетки и скульптуры  и продает их. Смбат признался, что  расстается  со статуетками сделанными им с трудностью. В основном он дарит статуетки своим друзям и знакомым , но часть из них продает на ярмарке и получает от продажи  приличную прибыль. У него большая мечта , организовать выставку в капане и показать свои любимые работы. 
Связи с весенним посевом Смбату нужен кредит на сумму 300,000 Армянских драм для покупки семян картофеля и для покупки сена для рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Smbat is 53 years old, he was born in the town of Kapan. He lives together with his wife, three sons and his mother in Kapan. All his sons work and help their parents to support their big and friendly family.

Smbat's main business is farming in which all of the family members are involved. They have a large plot of land near the house where they grow vegetables. Because the climate in Kapan is very favorable there many kinds of vegetables that can be found in Smbat's garden. There are also some types of citrus fruits that grow in the garden too.

Smbat also does animal husbandry, he has five cows, a calf and a horse. Smbat's wife takes care of the chickens and turkeys. Smbat and his family sell their agriculture produce on the produce markets in Kapan and Kadjaran. Besides that Smbat is a creative person, he is a sculptor. He has a small shop at home where he makes different sculptures from clay and gypsum and sells them. Smbat has confessed that it is hard for him to part with his sculptures. He mainly gives the sculptures to his friends, but part of them he sells on the festivals and gets a good profit from the sales. He has a big dream to organize and festival in Kapan and show his favorite works.

Because of the spring sowing Smbat needs a loan in the amount of 300,000 Armenian dram to buy seeds of potatoes and hay for the cattle.

loans.use: to buy seeds of potatoes for spring sowing and hay for the cattle.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 28 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Eduardo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores, a los que cuida en la casa que heredaron de sus padres.  Sus terrenos se encuentran a una hora de distancia del pueblo, por ello construyeron su casita muy cerca para cuidar sus terrenos agrícolas y sus sembríos, los cuales constan de papa y maíz. Aún no cuentan con terrenos propios, por eso alquilan extensas áreas por un año de esa manera ya no se preocupan de pagar el alquiler de manera mensual. Junto a sus esposo cuida, fertilizan y riegan sus sembríos, los dos trabajan, pues ambos toman decisiones importantes acerca de sus cultivos. “Despues de la cosecha, viajamos a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde vendemos nuestros alimentos”, comenta. Mientras cuida de sus sembríos, pasta a sus animales entre cerdos y ovejas, que le sirven como alimento, les gusta la vida en el campo y por lo pronto continuará trabajando y ahorrando para comprar su propia casa. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su trabajo , por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Rosa, invertirá S/ 1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico, para nutrir su próxima siembra de maíz y demás productos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 28 years old and is a humble woman. She lives with Eduardo, her husband. They have three young children, who they bring up in the house that they inherited from her parents. 

Their land is located one hour from town, so they built a small home close by to look after their agricultural land and crops- potatoes and corn. They still don't have their own land, so they rent large areas for a year, and for this reason they don't have to worry about paying the rent monthly. 

Alongside her husband, Rosa cares for, fertilizes and waters the plants. Both of them work, so they both make important decisions about their crops. “After the harvest, we travel to the city of Huancayo, where we sell our produce”, she explains. 

As well as tending her crops, she also grazes her pigs and sheep, which she rears for food.  They like life in the country and for the time being, they will continue to work and save to buy their own home. This is Rosa's second loan with Kiva. She is grateful for the opportunity given, since she can improve her work. For this reason, she promises to make her loan repayments on time.  Rosa will invest 1500 soles in buying organic fertilizer, to nourish her next crop of corn and other agricultural produce.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Tomik

texts.ru:
Tомик шахтер, он уже много лет как работает шахтером на Капанском горнообогадительном комбинате. Томик окончил Капанский горный техникум по специальности горняк.
Томику 56 лет .Он проживает в городе Капан вместе с женой. Дочь и сын Томика живут и работают в Ереване  и помогают родителям в Капане. 
Специальность Томика очень опасная и вредная для здоровья человека но он всегда любил свою специальность и работал с удовольствием, несмотря на трудности и тяжести. 
Но так как Томик уже немолодой, он решил занятся другим делом. Он открыл с женой свой собственный бизнес в капане . У них уже собственный магазин одежды в Капане. Жена Томика покупает одежду из оптовых рынках Еревана и привозит на перепродажу в Капан. 
По словам Томика занятие торговлей более выгоднее чем работать шахтером в Армении. Он доволен своей новой деятельностью.
Для ремонта своего маленького магазина одежды в Капане, Томику нужен кредит на сумму 1,000,000 Армянских драм. Он надеется на помощ кредиторов Кива.
texts.en:
Tomik is a 56-year-old miner. He has worked in the Kapan ore processing plant for many years. He completed the Kapan technical school with a specialty in mining. Tomik lives with his wife in Kapan while his daughter and son live and work in Yerevan. They help their parents in Kapan. 

Tomik's profession is very dangerous and harmful to human health. Although he has always loved his trade and happily worked as a miner despite the difficulties, Tomik is no longer so young and he decided to start working in another field. He and his wife have opened their own shop in Kapan. Tomik's wife purchases clothing at the wholesale markets in Yerevan and brings them to Kapan to resell. According to Tomik, it is more advantageous to work in sales than in mining in Armenia. Hence, he is satisfied with his new trade. 

Tomik needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian dram in order to renovate his small clothing shop in Kapan. He is hoping for help from Kiva.

loans.use: to repair his small clothing shop in Kapan

loans.name: Momajon

texts.ru: Момаджон жительница района Дж.Руми. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и имеет двух детей. У Момаджон высшее медицинское образование. Она работала в сфере медицины в течение 13 лет. Последние 3 года Момаджон занимается земледелием. Она выращивает пшеницу. Сейчас в сезон посева она уже посеяла пшеницу и теперь для обработки земли ей необходимы минеральные удобрения. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Полученный кредит она использует для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Она хочет получить богатый урожай пшеницы и за счет ее прибыли увеличить семейный бюджет.
texts.en:
Momajon lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 47 years old and married with two children. She has a university education in medicine, a field in which she worked for 13 years. 

For the past three years Momajon has been working in arable farming. She grows wheat. She has already sowed her wheat this planting season. Now she needs mineral fertilizers to till the land. Hence, she is turning to a loan, which she will use to purchase these mineral fertilizers. She wants to have a rich harvest of wheat in order to increase her family budget.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly  de 31 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina, masculina e infantil en su pequeño negocio el cual inició hace 10 años, ubicado en el municipio de Soledad donde habita con su hijo de 5 años de edad. Su actividad como comerciante la aprendió desde muy niña pues su padre la ejerció también y a Kelly le llamó mucho la atención. Por eso cuando indicó lo hizo de manera prudente y poco a poco vendiendo mercancía variada en un pequeño volumen. Hoy sus ventas han aumentado pues vende principalmente a crédito y su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para responder a la demanda de su mercado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará   ropa femenina, e infantil pues tiene encargos que responder y no ha logrado rotar rápidamente sus cuentas por cobrar. Su experiencia y capacidad de trabajo son los que condicionan su éxito en la inversión y especialmente la de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Kelly is 31 years old and makes a living selling women's, men's and children's clothing in her small business, which she set up ten years ago. It is located in the town of Soledad, where she lives with her five-year-old child. She learned how to run a store from a young age, since her father did the same, and it really caught Kelly's attention. For this reason, when she began, she did so carefully and gradually, selling small amounts of merchandize. 

Today, her sales have increased. She mainly sells on credit, and her working capital is not large enough to meet the demand for her clothes. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva, which she will use to buy women's and children's clothing. She has orders to take on and has not managed to rotate her accounts quickly enough to get paid. Her work experience and ability have guaranteed her success in the investment, especially that of the loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Elba Maria

texts.es:
Elba,  51 años de edad, originaria de Granada, casada, madre de 5 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, el cual solo 1 esta estudiando y los otros 4 trabajan, de oficio comerciante,  se dedica a la venta de productos de herbalife de la que es propietaria hace mas de  años, solo logro finalizar su segundo grado de primaria. Inicio sus actividades laborales a la edad de 20 años, empezó  con capital propio, vendiendo ropa, la cual necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir  con su  familia y poder salir adelante, es asi como ella se ganaba la vida a diario, luego con el tiempo ella decidió solo dedicarse a la ventas de productos herbalife,  negocio que le resulta muy rentable porque le genera ganancias a diarias, ella  comercializa  sus productos en la misma zona en donde vive, cuenta con clientes fijos.
Sus expectativas es expandir su negocio a otros lugares. Elba esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar  proteínas, multivitaminas  aloe, concentrado de hierbas, etc. Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar más productos que aun no tiene en existencias  con el objetivo de atraer más clientes, para poder incrementar sus venta.
texts.en:
Elba is 51 years old. She is from Granada, married, and the mother of 5 children. All of them are grown and one of them is in school while the rest of them work. She is a merchant and sells Herbalife products. She has owned her business for some years. She was only able to finish second grade of primary school and started her work when she was about 20 years old. She started with her own capital, selling clothes. She needed a way to survive and get ahead with her family, and that was how she earned her living. After time, she decided to only sell Herbalife products. The business is very profitable for her because it brings in daily earnings. She sells her products in the same area where she lives and has regular customers.

Her hopes are to to expand her business into other places. Elba is asking for the loan to buy proteins, multivitamins, aloe, herb concentrates, etc. She believes that this loan will help her to buy more products that don't exist yet, so she can attract more customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy proteins, multivitamins, aloe, herb concentrates, etc.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Maria Antonia tiene 65 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea de San Juan Pueblo.
Doña Maria, es muy trabajadora, ya tiene 3 años de tener un negocio de venta de ropa para damas como blusas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos, short. Esta venta la hace de manera ambulante en la comunidad y alrededores. Inicio este negocio con fondos propios y ayuda de financiamientos que le han permitido ha mantenerlo estable.
Ha solicitado este préstamo que es el numero nueve  de 10,000 lempiras para comprar ropa y surtir su inventario como blusas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos etc.
Su meta es es seguir trabajando y su negocio hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia is 65 years old. She is married, has 3 children and lives in the town of San Juan Pueblo.

Maria is very hardworking and for 3 years has had a business selling clothes for women, such as blouses, pants, dresses and shorts. She sells the clothes as a street vendor in and around the community. She started this business with her own money and help from loans that have allowed her to keep it stable. 

She has asked for this loan, which is her ninth and for 10,000 lempiras, to buy clothes and build her inventory with blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, etc. Her goal is to keep working and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothing to sell (blouses, pants,shorts, dresses).

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora, de 53 años , está casada con Antonio, con quien tiene 6 hijos, pero viven con 2 de ellos: Katerine y Josimar, en la casa que compraron desde hace unos años.Todos los días trabaja sin descanso, se levanta desde los primeros rayos de sol hasta el anochecer. Su principal actividad consiste en la siembra de alverja, olluco, papa y cereales, los cuales siembra en terrenos propios ubicados en la zona alta de su localidad. En todo este tiempo gracias a su dedicación y empeño logró adquirir un camión con el que trasporta sus alimentos y negocia en la ciudad de Lima, uno de los mercados más importantes a nivel nacional. Según comenta viaja una vez a la semana, pues también se dedica a la compra y venta de papa al por mayor, ganando un dinero extra en ello. Pero como mujer de campo también se dedica a la venta de los animales que cría y engorda. Ahora desea ahorrar para comprar otro camión nuevo y mejorado, pues ya trabajó muchos años con el que tiene.Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, espera de su apoyo financiero para que pueda concretar sus planes y a su vez se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual .Flora, invertirá los S/1700 soles en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa y olluco.
texts.en:
Flora is 53 years old, and is married to Antonio, with whom she has six children. They live with two of them, Katerine and Josimar, in the house that they bought a few years ago. She works tirelessly every day, getting up at dawn and finishing at sunset. Her main work involves sowing peas, ulluco, potatoes and grains, which she grows on her own land, located in the high region of her local area.

Over all this time, thanks to her dedication and hard work, she has managed to buy a truck, which she uses to transport her produce and sell it in the city of Lima, one of the biggest national markets. She says that she travels once a week, and also buys and sells wholesale potatoes, earning extra money through this. As a woman of the countryside, she also makes a living selling the animals that she rears and fattens up. 

Now, she wants to save up to buy another new, improved truck, as she's already worked for many years with her current one. This is her second loan with Kiva. With its financial support, she hopes to make her plans reality. At the same time, she promises to make her loan repayments on time. Flora will invest the 1700 soles in buying sacks of organic fertilizer to spread over her potato and ulluco crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es: Aida en su negocio de venta de calzado     bolsos, camisas y variedades, le ha ido muy bien con su credikiva pues con ellos ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo, comprar mucho mas, aumentar su clientela y generar mucha mas utilidad que con sus propios recursos. Así mismo su mayor impacto ha sido el de construir con su propio esfuerzo un pequeño apartamento, hizo también mejoras a su vivienda y todo está en su vida mucho mejor que antes.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará calzado, bolsos y variedades femeninas sobre pedidos que han hecho sus mejores clientes y justamente esto es lo que hace de su credikiva su mejor inversión.
texts.en: Aida's business is selling shoes, bags, shirts and various accessories. It has gone very well for her with her Kiva loans. With them, she has been able to increase her working capital, buy a lot more, increase her clientele and generate many more profits than she would have with her own resources. The biggest impact has been building, with her own work, her little apartment. She also did some home improvements and everything in her life is much better that it was before. Right now, she is applying for a new Kiva loan to buy shoes, bags, and various women's accessories to fill orders her best customers have made. That is just what makes her Kiva loan her best investment.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags, and various women's accessories to fill orders.

loans.name: Katherine Del Carmen

texts.es: Katherine de 32 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijas en las edades de 2 y 8 años, en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de la ciudad. Allí se dedica a vender mercancía variada, que distribuye en una clientela que ha ido construyendo hace más de un año, cuando su cuñado que vende frutas y verduras le dio un espacio en su local, para que Katherine iniciara su actividad. Su meta mas adelante es tener un punto fijo propio y sus sueños de crecimiento no se detienen, por eso agrega capital de crédito a su negocio por primera vez, acudiendo a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, donde se acercó a solicitar un credikiva al cual está aplicando; con el comprara accesorios domésticos útiles de papelería y artículos femeninos, que son los productos que mas rotan rápidamente y que hará de su credikiva su mejor inversión.
texts.en:
Katherine, 32, lives with her partner and two daughters aged 2 and 8 in the municipality of Malambo, part of the city’s [Barranquilla] metropolitan area. She sells varied goods to a customer base she has built for over a year, when her brother-in-law, who sells fruits and vegetables, lent her some space in his establishment to start with her activity.

Katherine’s goal for the future is to have her own establishment. She is continuously thinking to expand her business and this is why she wants to inject some capital for the first time. She came to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and requested a credikiva with which she will buy home accessories, stationery and accessories for women, which are the products that have the best inventory turnover and will make of her credikiva the best investment option.

loans.use: to buy home accessories, stationery and accessories for women.

loans.name: Luzalva

texts.es: Luzalva compró con su anterior credikiva, materias primas e insumos como telas, hilos, encajes para elaborar ropa infantil femenina, con ello aumentó su capital de trabajo y su capacidad de hacer compras mayores, pero aun no es suficiente para responder a su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará telas por rollos y accesorios, para continuar diseñando y confeccionando los hermosos vestidos infantiles que se ven muy lindos  cuando las niñas los lucen. Ella envía muchos saludos a sus financiadores de Kiva y a la Fundación y espera que la sigan apoyando ya que está le ha permitido incrementar su liquidez y sus utilidades.
texts.en:
With her previous loan from Kiva, Luzalva bought raw materials and supplies such as fabric, thread, and lace for making girl's clothing. Through this, she increased her capital and her ability to buy wholesale, but not by enough to meet her customer's requests. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Kiva, to buy rolls of fabric and accessories  so that she can continue to design and make the beautiful children's clothing that look wonderful when worn by little girls.

She sends her greetings to lenders from Kiva and the Foundation and hopes that they continue to support her, since this has helped her to increase her liquidity and profits.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric and accessories.

loans.name: Romão

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 6 filhos, dos quais alguns ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É dactilografo já a bastante tempo e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, areia, cimento, barrotes, blocos e outros) para continuar com a ampliação da sua casa.
No futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa para oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir ter outras fontes de rendimento.
texts.en:
Romão is married and the father of 6 children, some of whom still go to School, lives in his own house and doesn't support anyone else. 

He has been a typist for quite some time and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (iron, sand, cement, beams, block and others) to continue to expand his house.

In future he intends to complete the building work on his house and provide better levels of comfort for his family. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to obtain other sources of income.

loans.use: buy construction materials (iron, sand, cement, beams, block and others) to continue to expand his house.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is currently 52 years of age and retired from formal employment.  After having gone through the hurdles of being employed he resorted to cattle fattening on the small piece of land he bought with his savings. 

He is married with 3 children who are all in school.  His main vision while he was still in employment was to become self-employed which he realized after retiring from his formal job to start his cattle fattening business.  Enock now boasts of having been able to build a permanent residential house, acquired a big chunk of land and is able to cater for his family needs comfortably without depending on a salary.  He has applied for a loan of SHS 2,000,000 from UGAFODE to increase his number of livestock with a target of selling them in the peak December season

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 34 year old man, married with two sons.  He sells fruits, such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates and bananas.  Kamal has 8 years of experience in this field and gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for his business. 

Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during the year.  People like to eat it fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests.  His shop located in the center bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruits.  His monthly income from this business is 100 AZN.  Kamal `s wife helps him to sell fruits.

Kamal wants to expand his business.  The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand.  He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover as well, in order to improve life for his family.  For this purpose he applied for 1,500 AZN loan.  He has a long and positive history with AqroInvest.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to increase turnover

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old, married with 1 child.  She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  She owns and operates a fruit and vegetable stand in the local community to earn a living.  She has been with her business for over 7 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, like fruits and vegetable.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like fruits and vegetable

loans.name: Amani-Hondogo Group

texts.en:
MAULID, who is in his late twenties, is married with two sons, one of whom goes to school and another one is still a baby.  He has been planting and selling vegetables right from his garden since 2002.  He works from 4.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be MAULID's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to start buying and selling traditional chicken, bought fertilizers, insecticide and has paid back all of his loans successfully.  He used the interest to buy a plot of land.  He dreams of building his own house and to pay school fees.  He will use this loan to buy an irrigation machine. 

Maulid will share this loan with his loan group "Amani-Hondogo" with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy an irrigation machine and seeds to plant.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks like soap, canned goods, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.  Teodora has been in this business for 50 years. Teodora earns additional income from fishing.

Teodora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like soap, canned goods, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jossias

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos, todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.
É negociante e dono do seu próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, arroz, peixe, refrescos, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e criar gado, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é investir mais no seu negócio para obter mais lucros e manter se saudável
texts.en:
Jossias is married and the father of 5 children, all of whom attend School. He lives in his own house and doesn't support anyone else other than his children.

He's a trader and owns his own business selling various products. With this loan, he plans to buy products (peanuts, rice, fish, beverages and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

In future, Jossias hopes to grow his business and raise cattle. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to invest more in his business to obtain more profits and to stay healthy.

loans.use: buy products (peanuts, rice, fish, beverages and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

loans.name: Agamahammad

texts.en:
Agamahammad is a 52 year-old-man and married with three children. He has bred sheep for the last 10 years.  His pension was too small to cover the needs of his family, so he decided to start his business. 

He usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them for three to five months and then resells them for profit in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 150 AZN, and this business is only one source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. He also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.
  
Agamahammad wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He has applied for a 2,000 AZN loan to purchase 15 sheep and one milk cow.  He has a long and positive loan history with AqroInvest.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep and one milk cow.

loans.name: Gonçalves

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como empacotador de bananas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, chapas, aros, barrotes, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a insuficiência de fundos para realizar todos os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Gonçalves is married and the father of 2 children who are already of age, lives in his own house and doesn't support anyone else.

He works as a banana packer. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (iron, metal sheets, rings, beams and others) to continue the building work on his house.

In future Gonçalves hopes to complete and furnish his home. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to make all his projects a reality.

loans.use: buy construction materials (iron, metal sheets, rings, beams and others) to continue the building work on his house.

loans.name: Mateus

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais 3 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operário agrícola numa empresa de fabrico de bananas e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, blocos, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir e mobilar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é manter-se saudável para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Mateus is married and the father of 5 children, 3 of whom attend School. He lives in his own house and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a farmer for a company producing bananas. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (cement, sand, block and others) to continue the building work on his house.

In future he hopes to complete and furnish his home. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to stay healthy in order to make all his projects a reality.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, sand, block and others) to continue the building work on his house.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 31 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Peninah has been working hard to manage her mobile money and retail store, which sells airtime cards and phone accessories. 

To help expand her business, Peninah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy phone accessories and will help her to generate greater profits and increase stock. Peninah hopes that in the future she will be able to create another business. 

Peninah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peninah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is 58 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and son in Gori District. Nina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Nina milks cows and produces cheese to sell at local markets at a good price. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nina requested a loan from Credo to start up the family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. They do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Nina will purchase calves. After purchasing calves, she will raise them and increase cheese production in future. With another part of the loan she plans to buy rose saplings. She will plant rose saplings and sell the grown ones. This will be an additional source of income for the family, and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves and rose saplings.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old, married to a government employee, and has four children. She owns and operates a retail store in their village, which she has been doing for almost six years.  She earns a net income of 2,500 PHP a month. 

Edna is requesting a loan for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, and breads. Her profit usually goes to their daily expenditures. With this loan, Edna would like to gain more income with her business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, and breads.

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 5 filhos, todos maiores de idade, vivem na casa própria e sustenta a sua sobrinha que vive com ela.
Trabalha como empregada de escritório e tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos diversos.Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para o transporte de mercadoria, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é manter-se saudável para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Laura is a widow and the mother of 5 children, all of age. They live in her house which she owns and she supports a niece who lives with her.

She works as an office worker and has a business selling various products. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (cement, sand stone, iron and others) to continue the building work on her house.

In future she hopes to finish her home and buy a vehicle to transport her goods. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to stay healthy in order to make all of her projects a reality.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, sand stone, iron and others) to continue the building work on her house.

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa is an Egyptian from one of the two most vulnerable ethnic minority communities of central Albania; she is married and has four grownup children.
“Like the majority of people in my community, I enjoy buying & selling second-hand items. I have been doing this for years. It is fun and you make good money if you want to. This business started in the early nineties from Romas and Egyptians and has grown since. Albanians are poor, especially in the country sides or towns, so it is cheaper for them to visit our stores versus the ones that sell brand new clothes,” Shpresa said, smiling.

Shpresa is now applying for a loan to finish renovating her store and buy some more used items to resell.

loans.use: to finish renovating her store and buy more second-hand items to resell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia, 56, has a piggery business. She has been doing it for over three years now. From her business, she acquires about 7,000 PHP for each pig. Now, Cecilia has decided to borrow a loan of 6,000 PHP in addition to her working capital. She will buy feed, vitamins and medicine to nourish her livestock more. Cecilia hopes to make her family's quality of life improve through her hard work and perseverance.

loans.use: buy feed, vitamins and medicine

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 45 years old. She lives in Kutaisi, West Georgia, with her sister and 23-year-old son.  Irma requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Irma and her sister are working at the local market selling flowers, and they get a small monthly salary which is rarely enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Irma requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Irma will rent a counter at the local market and purchase flowers at wholesale prices. She and her sister will then sell them with a price markup. The profit will be used for reinvesting and buying more flowers. As they are both experienced in this field, Irma hopes the business will be successful. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family and give them a chance to have a better life.

loans.use: To rent a counter at the local market and purchase flowers at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Octávia

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos, dos quais apenas 1 frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como auxiliar de serviços.Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, blocos, pedra, ferro, e outros) para ampliar a sua residência. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e sustentar os estudos do seu filho, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e conseguir manter se saudável para garantir a execução de seus projectos.
texts.en:
Octávia is single and the mother of 2 children, only 1 of whom goes to School. She lives in her own house and doesn't support anyone else.

She works as a maid. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (cement, sand, blocks, stone, iron and others) to expand her house.

In future she hopes to finish her home and support her son through his studies. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work harder and stay healthy to guarantee that she can carry out her projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, sand, blocks, stone, iron and others) to expand her house.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is 51 years old now and married to Musa, who contributes to the family income. She has been in the rental business and the business is doing well. She gets a monthly income of about 50,000 KES.

She wants to use this loan to paint her houses to improve their look and hopes to continue building more rental houses.

loans.use: to paint her houses to improve their look.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 48 years old and married with 8 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a tricycle service in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 5 years and earns about 3,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Margare

texts.en:
Margaret is 38 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is single and has 7 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 17 years, Margaret has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, flour, rice and other items. 

To help expand her business, Margaret has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy and stock sugar, flour, rice and other items, and will help Margaret to generate greater profits and increase the income level of the family. Margaret hopes that in the future she will be able to look after her family. 

Margaret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margaret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy and stock sugar, flour, rice and other items.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, now 39 years of age, used his previous loan amount to buy more stock of retail goods to sell. These included sugar, cooking oil and cosmetics. It was profitable and he was able to pay all the loan amount well and in good time.

This being his fourth loan term, he plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of flour, sugar, detergents and bread to sell. This will enable him to have enough stock as well as to generate more income, which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Thomas hopes to open a wholesale shop and be financially stable so as to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of flour, sugar, detergents and bread.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has four grown children. She operates a sari-sari or variety store business. She has been in this business for four years now. She sells soft drinks, food snacks, noodles, candies and bread. This is the source of her income for the needs of the family.

Aurora is requesting a loan to buy canned goods, toiletries, sugar, food snacks, milk, noodles and seasonings. These are the items that she sells in her store. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs to gain more profit and income.

In the future, Aurora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, toiletries, sugar, food snacks, milk, noodles and seasonings.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 28 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Revaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is a small monthly income earned by his wife working as saleslady at a local market. It totals 300 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Revaz requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Revaz will install gas equipment in his car, as it is much cheaper than petrol. He plans to serve local people as a taxi driver and earn money. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Mulinge

texts.en:
Mulinge has a butchery business in Tala town. He has been running his business for the last seven years. He is 40 years old and married to Rose. The couple has two children, ages 15 and 10.

This will be his first loan and he plans to use it to buy more stock of meat to sell. This will enable him to generate more income with which he plans to pay the school fees for his children.

Mulinge hopes to expand his business by opening another butchery, enabling him to make more income and better provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of meat to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 28 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is single and has one child. For the past four years, Francis  has been working hard to manage his salon, where he cuts hair. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to acquire shaving machines, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and help the business grow. Francis hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand and lay out a cosmetics store. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to acquire shaving machines.

loans.name: Rohila

texts.en:
Rohila is 24 years old. She is married but does not have any children. She is a hardworking woman and always tries to improve her living conditions. She worked in Russia as a cleaner but her income was small. 

Some months ago, she returned to Tajikistan. Now, Rohila wants to organize her own business selling clothes. She wants to buy clothes at the central market and resell them to other regions. Her mother will help her manage the business. 

She is asking for a loan of $1,300 to buy clothes so she can start a new business selling clothes. She awaits your support. This loan will help her to improve her living conditions and, in this way, to stimulate her life.

loans.use: To buy clothes so she can start her new business.

loans.name: Mshikamano Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Maroa, who is in his early 40s is married with four children, three boys and one girl.  All of them go to school.  He has been selling stationary for two years now.  He used to sell phone accessories but now is in the stationary business.  He works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 
 
This will be Maroa's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling stationary and buy more stock of stationary. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profits to pay his children's school fees and continue building his house. He will use this loan to buy a camera and start a shooting business, in addition to his stationary business. His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house.

Maroa will share this loan with his loan group "Mshikamano Tegeta," which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a camera and start a shooting business.

loans.name: Felix Jr.

texts.en:
Felix, Jr. is a fisherman from CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of two children. Felix, Jr. has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 10 years now.

Felix, Jr. is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for his boat. With this loan, he will be able to improve his fishing business and his income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for his boat.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
