With the received credit, Gocha will purchase melon seedlings. He and his father will cultivate land to sow the melons to harvest and sell locally at the markets. The profit will be used to reinvest in the same business, and Gocha will sow more melons, which will increase the family’s income. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will give Gocha a chance to look after his aged parents and to provide better living conditions for them.

loans.use: to purchase melon seedlings.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a business that buys and sells fruits and root crops in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Susana is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase bananas, coconuts and root crops to sell to customers.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, coconuts and root crops to sell to customers.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Florinda toda su vida a trabajado en el rubro de la agricultura, desde hace 10 años se dedica a cultivar café. El cual vende en café pergamino en el mercado local y el precio de este producto es rentable y se mantiene. Dice que se siente motivada a seguir trabajando con los financiamientos y gracias a eso sus cultivos se han mantenido en buena calidad.
Actualmente esta solicitando su tercer préstamo de 6,000 lempiras el cual lo utilizara para comprar abono y mantenimiento de la finca.
La meta en el futuro es sembrar una manzana mas de café , para generar mas ingresos para seguir ayudando a sus familia.
texts.en:
Florinda is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She lives in a village of Taulabe, Comayagua.

Florinda has worked in agriculture her whole life.  She has worked growing coffee for 10 years, selling it as pergamino coffee in the local market .  The price of this product is profitable and maintains itself.  

She says that she feels motivated to keep working with Kiva and that thanks to this, her crop has consistently been of good quality.

She is now asking for her third loan of 6,000 lempirs (US$325), which she will use to buy fertilizer and maintain her farm.

Her goal in the future is to sow another field of coffee so as to generate more income and continue helping her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and maintain her farm.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is widowed and works hard to support her family. She has a rope-making business in the Philippines. 

Lolita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her rope-making.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her rope-making.

loans.name: Denys

texts.es: Denis habita en la linda ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 7 a 13 años. Allí se dedica a la venta de productos variados, tiene un Kiosco donde además vende refrescos y alimentos en general. Junto a su cónyuge siempre han estado interesados en el comercio y con ello han sacado adelante a su familia. Su negocio se encuentra bien ubicado y con el apoyo de sus proveedores ha estado surtido de refrescos, Hoy está aplicando aun credikiva porque necesita diversificar su oferta para vender más, esta es la razón por la que comprará productos de papelería por mayor volumen y refrescos ., con los cuales obtendrá mejores precios que los acostumbrados. Este es su primer financiamiento y espera fortalecer su inventario y crecer cada día mas.
texts.en:
Denis lives in the beautiful city of Cartagena de Indias, where she lives with her spouse and their 3 children, ages 7 and 13.  There, she works selling various products.  She also has a kiosk where she sells soft drinks and common foods. She and her spouse have always been interested in retail and with it they have helped their family progress.  Her business is well located and well stocked with the support of her suppliers.

Today, she is asking for a Kiva loan because she needs to expand her selection in order to sell more.  This is her reason for buying paper products wholesale and soft drinks.  With these things, she will be able to have better prices than normal.

This is her first loan and she hopes to strengthen her inventory and grow every day.

loans.use: buy soft drinks and paper products wholesale

loans.name: Nambasana Group

texts.en:
Jackline is a member of Nambasana Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 5 women and 5 men. Jackline is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of millet, and sorghum cultivation. Jackline first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Jackline joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and get the best harvests.

Jackline described her harvest as good last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and she hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to buy a cow and a goat and  send her children to school. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Jackline’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ona

texts.en:
Ona is married and has two children. She always wanted to provide them with good education and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Ona decided to start new business with animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

Ona studied at the course of ‘To get ahead’ in a women's organization and got enough skills in business.  Her son and husband will help her with business. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy cattle to organize her new business. She will get through, using the loan, and her business will go to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle so as to organize a new business

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
She has operated a firewood and fruit-selling business. Her goal is to continue working and growing her business, which in turn will provide her with the means to keep working.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying vegetables, fruits, groceries and other items in order to stock her store and carry on working as she is now.

loans.use: to invest in buying vegetables, fruits, groceries and other items.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Beatriz de 21 años de edad vive al sur e la ciudad con su cónyuge y produce y vende calzado mediante pequeños créditos, que ofrece a su clientela, ella maneja la línea femenina e informal como las sandalias y zapatos formales elegantes. Desde hace 2 años  y por sugerencia de varias de sus amistades, inició su negocio, con un pequeño mercado doméstico entre vecinos y referidos; poco a poco se ha extendidos a otros sectores y su clientela ha crecido gradualmente. Cuando recupera sus cuentas por cobrar, muchas veces no alcanza a comprar  materiales en los volúmenes exigibles para hacer una mayor producción y vender mucho mas . Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales e insumos, como cueros, accesorios y capelladas, para producir nuevos diseño y ofrecerlos a un mercado, que cada vez exige mayor actualización de sus productos, porque quieren estar a la moda.
texts.en: Beatriz is 21 years old, lives with her husband, and makes and sells shoes with the help of small loans that she offers to her customers.  She manages feminine and informal lines such as sandals and formal shoes.  She started her business two years ago on the suggestion of several friends and with a small local market among neighbors and references.  Little by little she has expanded into other sectors and her number of customers has increased.  When she collects what is owed to her, she doesn’t always have enough to buy supplies in sufficient quantities to have a large production and make more sales.  This is why she has requested her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the money to buy supplies such as leather, accessories and tops to be able to make new designs and offer them to her customers who constantly request the latest so they can be in style.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a junk shop in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more recycled materials.

Jocelyn has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Upendo is a group of 12 farmers in Chwele District represented by Emily. All are women. Emily is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of millet and sorghum. Emily joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Emily joined One Acre Fund so that she could conveniently get farm inputs and grow enough food for the family.

Emily described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and buy a cow. Emily’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 6 acres of millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en: Asiya is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to increase revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. This is her fourth loan and she has a good repayment history. Asiya is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Pedro De Jesus

texts.es: Pedro de 45 años de edad es un hombre casado, que habita en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 5 a 14 años de edad. Allí se dedica a  la venta de ranchos, víveres, refrescos, y todos los artículos de la canasta familiar, en una pequeña tienda ubicada en su domicilios. Sus principales clientes son las amas de casa, que se congregan diariamente para hacer sus compras rutinarias, de alimentos que van a preparara  para ser consumidos por sus familias. Su negocio lo inició desde el año 2009, basado en el aprendizaje que recibió de su familia, la que siempre tuvo tienda. Fue así, que cuando conformó su hogar aprovechó su experiencia, para generar ingresos independientes y sacarlo adelante. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credkiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará abarrotes, cárnicos y víveres, en un mayor volumen, para ganar nuevos descuentos y trasladarlo a los precios que ofrece pues   necesita ser muy competitivo, para sostenerse en el mercado. Esto es lo que hace exitoso  la inversión de Kiva, además de su capacidad de trabajo y disposición para aplicar sus recursos al negocio y generar ingresos que forjan el bienestar a su hogar.
texts.en: Pedro, 45 years old, is a married man who lives in the city of Cartagena with his partner and his three children, who are 5 to 14 years old. There he sells snacks, groceries, soft drinks, and all the household staple goods in a small shop located in his house. His main customers are housewives who congregate daily to do their routine shopping for food that they will prepare for their families. He started his business in 2009 based on what he learned from his family, who always had a shop. Thus, when he formed his household, he took advantage of his experience to generate independent income and move the household ahead. Currently he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy groceries, meat products, and convenience store items in greater volume in order to obtain new discounts and pass it on in his prices, since he needs to be very competitive to sustain himself in the market. This is what makes Kiva's investment successful, in addition to his capacity for work and his willingness to apply his resources to the business and generate income that will shape the well-being of his household.

loans.use: to buy groceries, meat products, and convenience store items

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe has a business operating a mobile charging shop and electronics shop selling electronic equipment (speakers, buffers, woofers, radios, car radios, flash drives, and various other pieces of equipment). She works Monday through Saturday, and she is very well-known in the area. She has gotten a very good clientele thanks to the fact that she always has what her customers need.

She is requesting another Kiva loan to buy speakers, buffers, woofers, radios, and other items. She will do this in order to be able to continue working and giving her customers a good variety. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving because it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy speakers, buffers, woofers, radios, and others.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en: Bano is a 36-year-old married woman. Six years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales. She buys clothes of different designs from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells them in her community. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet their daily requirements while Bano makes enough to contribute to the family's income. She counts a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors. She has gradually improved her business. She requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy an ample variety of clothes for the summer season to add to her current stock. She intends to use the earned profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of clothes for the summer season to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Huruma Shg Group

texts.en:
Ezekiel’s group has 11 farmers and is located in Chwele District. Ezekiel is pictured on the right of Huruma SHG Group with his hand raised. Ezekiel is pictured amongst the four men and seven women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum and millet. Ezekiel first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Ezekiel joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Ezekiel described his harvest as good last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and buy a goat. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Ezekiel’s group will receive 5.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Osiris

texts.es: Osiris es una mujer de 50 años de edad que vive en Turbaco (Bolivar) con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 19 y 25 años. Ella en el municipio es muy conocida por su oficio de confeccionista, actividad a la que se vinculó desde hace 15 años, aprovechando el aprendizaje que de su madre obtuviera desde muy niña y que ella  usó en el futuro para generar ingresos y apoyar el bienestar de su familia. Poco a poco compró sus herramientas, maquinarias  equipos y con sus vecinos fue acreditándose;  hoy sus principales líneas de productos son los uniformes escolares, por los que consigue algunos contratos en los colegios o directamente con los padres de familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Sato Domingo, mediante el cual comprará tela en mayor volumen e insumos, con ello ganará mejores descuentos y ofrecerá a su clientela precios competitivos, que la hacen de mayor reconocimiento en la población. Su meta es surgir para que sus hijos sean profesionales de bien y tengan éxito, pues es lo que más añora.
texts.en: Osiris is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Turbaco (Bolivar) with her spouse. She has 2 children who are 19 and 25 years old. She is very well-known in the city for her work as a tailor. She has been doing this work for 15 years, taking advantage of what she learned from her mother from the time she was very young, which she used later to earn income and support her family's well-being. Little by little she bought her tools, machines and equipment, and she gained a good reputation with her neighbors. Today her main product lines are school uniforms, for which she has some contracts with schools in addition to direct sales to parents. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy fabric in greater volume as well as supplies. With it, she will obtain better discounts and will offer her customers competitive prices that gain her wider recognition. Her goal is to move forward so that her children will be respectable, successful professionals, since that is what she yearns for most.

loans.use: to buy fabric in greater volume as well as supplies

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a 38 year old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Musarat embroidery’s patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She receives orders for special occasions like weddings and parties and makes enough to fulfill the needs of her three children. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy raw materials such as spools of thread with packs of sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand. Her dream is to run a training center for the girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of thread with packs of sequins and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Absalon Jesus

texts.es:
ABSALON JESUS tiene 56 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa con unos afamiliares en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

ABSALON JESUS tiene un taller de pintura, Solicita el crédito para comprar pintura de colores fuertes, pinceles, brochas, tiñer. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para seguir trabajando.

Las compras las realiza cada 8 días en la ciudad de Guaranda. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es luchar contra culquier problema que se presente. El sueño es mejorar el negocio. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce con la familia.
texts.en:
Absalon Jesus is 56 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives in a house with family members in the city of Chimbo in Bolívar province.

Absalon Jesus has a painting workshop. He is asking for the loan to buy paint in bright colors, brushes, and paint thinner. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs to continue working.

He makes the purchases once a week in the city of Guaranda. The challenges he faces are to fight against any problem that presents itself. His dream is to improve the business. In his free time he likes to get together with his family.

loans.use: to buy paints in bright colors, brushes, and paint thinner

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 59 años de edad tiene un taller de electrónica en la ciudad de Cartagena donde habita con su cónyuge con quien conforma su familia y sus 3 hijos adultos. Desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a reparar y mantener artefactos eléctricos y hoy electrónicos. en su local donde está ubicado su taller. Las necesidades de comprar repuestos lo han llevado a vender también este tipo de artículos y hoy quiere agregar muchos más y ordenarlos en una vitrina. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual los adquirirá. Con su inversión logrará tener inventarios para ofrecerlos al mercado y por ello ganará nuevos ingreso y un mayor número de clientes, lo que hará de su inversión de Kiva  la más exitosa.
texts.en: Antonio, 59 years old, has an electronics workshop in the city of Cartagena, where he lives with his partner, with whom he has his family, and their 3 grown children. For 20 years he has repaired and maintained electrical and now electronic devices in the building where his workshop is located. The need to buy spare parts has led him to also sell this type of item, and now he wants to add many more and arrange them in a display case. This is why he is taking out a Kiva loan. This is his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will receive the loan. With his investment, he will be able to have inventory to offer to the market. Through it he will earn new income and have more customers, which will make his Kiva loan the most successful one.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and a display case

loans.name: Idania Dalila

texts.es:
Idania tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive con su madre y su hijo en una colonia de la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Idania tiene un negocio de una pequeña  pulperia, lo inicio hace 2 años con capital propio. Vende golosinas, frijoles, arroz, productos de abarroteria etc.  Idania se vio en la obligación de tener una fuente de ingreso después que ya no recibía la ayuda del padre de su hijo, es una persona muy emprendedora y manifiesta que poco a poco su negocio ha ido mejorando.
Ella solicita su primer préstamo a Odef de 4,300 lempiras para invertir en el negocio para comprar refrescos, golosinas, huevos etc. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y las ganancias las trabajara en el negocio.
Su meta es darle a su hijo estabilidad y educación necesaria.
texts.en:
Idania is a 23-year-old single mother. She lives with her son and her mother in a neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Idania has a small store that she established two years ago with her own capital. She sells snack foods, beans, rice, groceries, and other items. Idania feels obligated to have a source of income since she does not receive support from the father of her child. She is a very enterprising person and believes that her business is gradually improving.

Idania is requesting her first loan from ODEF in the amount of 4,300 HNL so that she can invest in her business. She will buy soft drinks, snack foods, eggs, and other products. The investment will increase the earnings generated from her business. Her goal is to provide her son with stability and the necessary education.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snack foods, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Cheick Mohamed Mansor

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheick Mohamed Mansor est âgée  de 36 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il  vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Darsalam de  Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné très tôt l’école, il commença à faire l’apprenti tailleur  auprès de son grand frère. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à son côté, il évolue seul pour mener la même activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Il  jouit d’une grande expérience et notoriété. Sa force de vente est due à son génie de création mais également à son accueil clientèle. Il fait toujours ses prestations  au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa demande clientèle  et de se mettre en concert avec l’évolution et les tendances du moment, il sollicite ce prêt. Il est à son 1er prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter une  machine à coudre,  il   s’approvisionne sur place.  
Monsieur Cheick Mohamed Mansor envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de  80.000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales et d’augmenter son fonds de commerce.  Son ambition est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mister Cheick Mohamed Mansor is 36 years old, married and father to 3 children. He lives in a traditional family in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).

Having left school very young, he started as an apprentice tailor with his older brother. After several years as an apprentice at his side, he started out on his own in the same business which he has been managing for 20 years now. He enjoys great experience and notoriety. His ability in sales is due to his genius in creation but also to the welcome he gives his clientele. He always provides his service for cash to a mixed clientele.

He is requesting this loan due to the concern of satisfying the demands of his clientele and to put himself in line with the tendencies of today. He is on his first individual loan which will be used to buy a sewing machine. He gets his supplies locally.

Mister Cheick Mohamed Mansor envisions making a monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA. This will allow him to take care of the family expenses and to increase his business. His ambition is to build a home.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is a 57-year-old woman, married with three children. She is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods such as flour, beverages, macaronis, butter and candies. She has eight years of experience and has a deep knowledge of the market and demand of clients. 

The food products she sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling food is 100 AZN. Her husband helps to purchase the products and bring them to the shop. This is the only income in her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location, in the central bazaar of her home city.

Sevda applied for a 2,000 AZN loan to purchase more food products and diversify her range of goods so as to cover customers' demand. This will be her third loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy and diversify her range of goods to cover her customers' demand.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 35 years old. She is a plantain chips seller who is married to Evans, a 41-year-old taxi driver. They have four children. She resides at Zabrama Line in the Dansoman community.

She joined ID Ghana in 2011 when she was in need of some capital to revamp her business.

She has been doing this business for five years now. She is grateful to ID Ghana for the training on savings which motivated her to save to achieve her dream. 

This is her 4th loan and she needs GHS 500 to buy more plantains to fry to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more plantains to fry to sell to customers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga  in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, David has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells sugar, flour, rice and others. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, flour, rice and other products, and will help David to generate greater profits, boost the business and increase the income of the family. David hopes that in the future he will be able to get profits from the business.

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour and rice.

loans.name: Miriam Lisseth

texts.es:
Miriam  tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, y vive con su esposo y sus padres en una aldea de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Miriam se dedica de la agricultura, desde hace 3 años se dedica a cultivar café. El cual vende en café pergamino en el mercado local y el precio de este producto es rentable y se mantiene. A ella le ha gustado mucho trabajar la tierra ya que con este negocio ha solventado los gastos del  hogar.
Actualmente esta solicitando un  préstamo de 16,000 lempiras el cual lo utilizara para comprar abono, siembra de de café y para el mantenimiento de la finca.
La meta  que ella tiene es seguir creciendo sus cultivos y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam is 40 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and parents in a small village in Taulabe, Comayagua. 

Miriam is a farmer. For 3 years, she has grown coffee, which she sells in the local market. The price of this product yields a profit and she supports herself. She has liked working the land a lot, since with this business she has covered her household expenses. 

Currently she is requesting a loan of 16,000 lempiras, which she will use to buy manure and coffee seeds and maintain the farm. 

Her goal is to continue growing her crops and helping her family.

loans.use: to grow coffee, buy fertilizer, and maintain her crops

loans.name: Agabala

texts.en:
Agabala is a 53-year-old man, married with three children. He is a market vendor and sells spare parts and different motor oils in his shop. He has 10 years of experience in this field and his monthly income is 200 AZN. He started his business because he lost his job and he was far from being able to get a pension. The merchandise he sells is in high demand because he sells only high quality spare parts and motor oils, which is not usual for rural places.

Agabala applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN to purchase more spare parts in case to respond to customers' demand. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to respond to his customers' demand.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
Malik is a 57-year-old man, married with two sons. He sells food products such as macaronis, butter, cookies, sugar, tea, candies and beverages in his shop. Malik has 10 years of experience in this field, and he is considered as knowledgeable and skilled. He is a school teacher, but his salary is too small to cover the needs of his beloved sons. 

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 100 AZN. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, in the central bazaar of his home city. 

The profit he gains is not enough to reinvest it into the business and his ability to respond to his customers' demand is suffering for this reason. Being main source of income, his profit is used for family needs. Malik would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. 

For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN. He will purchase a a bigger diversity of foodstuffs. This will be his fifth loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger diversity of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is a 32-year-old provision-seller who resides in Dansoman. She joined ID Ghana in 2011 and is doing very well in her business.
 
She has been doing this business for five years now. She buys from the market in the the capital and sells in the Dansoman community. She is a very hardworking individual.

This is her 3rd loan with ID Ghana and she needs a loan of GHS 500 to buy more goods to sell to her customers. 

She will use this money to buy two boxes of milk, one bag of rice, one box of milo and a bag of sugar.

loans.use: To buy two boxes of milk, one bag of rice, one box of milo and a bag of sugar to sell to customers.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet and her husband do their best to give her child everything needed for her studies so that one day she can become successful and honest person. 

This loan will be used to buy an over-lock machine, more supplies in bulk such as fabrics of different types and colors, thread, buttons, and zippers. As a result, she will be able to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy an over-lock machine, more supplies in bulk such as fabrics of different types and colors, thread, buttons, and zippers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 35-year-old man from Vihiga County. He is married to Beullah and they have two children aged five and two years old.

John is a carpenter, a business he has done for the past 13 years earning a monthly income of KES 5,470. This is his second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd., which he plans to use to buy wood to make furniture. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and expand the business. His dream is to open a show room for his finished furniture and give his family the best life.

loans.use: To buy stocks of timber.

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en:
Nazim is a 52-year-old man who is married and has two sons. He is a market vendor and sells different kind of food products in the central bazaar. Nazim has 9 years of experience in this field, and is considered as a knowledgeable and skilled person.

He usually sells rice, macaronis, yoghurt, ketchup, sugar and others. The products he sells are in very high demand and people use them in everyday life. Also these products are in very high demand among local people and his monthly profit is 100 AZN. His spouse helps him to update the merchandise in his shop.
 
Nazim also works as the head of the office, and this business is not the only financial income in his family. Nonetheless, Nazim would like to invest more and develop his business. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He will use this loan to purchase more products. He has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy more products.

loans.name: Raziyya

texts.en:
Raziyya is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods such as flour, beverages, macaronis, butter, and candies. She has five years of experience, and she has deep knowledge of the market and demand from clients. 

The food products she sells are very popular and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 100 AZN. She is a teacher in the local school and spends half of each day teaching children. Her mother helps to sell products while she is at school. This is the primary source of income for her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location, in the central bazaar of her home city.

She applied for a 2,000 AZN loan to purchase more food products and to increase the variety of goods she offers in order to meet her customers' demand. This will be her second loan and she has good client history.

loans.use: to buy more and varied food products

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is 52 years old, divorced, and has two daughters. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods such as flour, beverages, macaronis, butter, and candies. She has eight years of experience and deep knowledge of the market and demand from clients. 

The food products she sells are very popular and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 100 AZN. Her daughter helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the only source of income for her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location, in the central bazaar of her home city.

She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase more food products and to add new and varied goods to her inventory in order to meet her customers' demand. This will be her second loan and she has good client history.

loans.use: to buy more and varied food products

loans.name: Dobrila

texts.en:
Dobrila is a 56-year-old divorced woman. She is living in a minority community. Dobrila is an experienced woman when it comes to business, selling different products and bags for women, children, etc. She began two years ago to run this business. She considers her business to be fairly profitable. With the income she earns, she is able to cover her expenses. 

With the requested sum of 400 EUR, she will invest in buying more items to sell. The loan will help her increase the range of products she offers, and will make her business more profitable. 

She is counting on this help in order to continue with her goals. She also promises to be punctual in making her payments. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra de 32 años de edad habita en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 2 años y 3 meses de nacido. Ella es propietaria de un pequeño jardín infantil que funciona desde hace 2 años después de haberse licenciado como  pedagoga infantil en la universidad y darle curso libre a su aptitud independiente y emprendedora. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mari Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará material didáctico moderno, sillas y mesas porque son implementos que requiere para la comodidad y seguridad de sus pequeños clientes. Su inversión será exitosa porque maneja mucha experiencia en la comunidad y la reconocen por su calidad en el trabajo con infantes por lo cual se sostiene en el mercado. Su meta es de crecimiento en cobertura, porque planea educar a sus hijos con los principios de calidad exitosa que requiere el futuro, para que tengan una vida con mucho bienestar.
texts.en: Sandra, 32 years old, lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and her two children, a two-year-old and a three-month-old newborn. She is the owner of a small kindergarten that she has run for 2 years, after being licensed as an early childhood education teacher at the university and giving free rein to her independent and entrepreneurial ability. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy modern teaching materials, chairs, and desks because she needs them for the comfort and safety of her little customers. Her investment will be successful because she has a lot of experience in the community and she is recognized for the quality of her work with children, so she supports herself in the market. Her goal is to grow her enrollment because she plans to educate her children with the successful quality principles that the future requires so that they will have a very comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy modern teaching materials, chairs, and desks

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has a cereal-selling business in Tala town. She has been in business for the past 13 years and it has been profitable. She is 38 years old, married and has four children.

This will be her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of cereals to sell. These include rice and mostly beans which are now being harvested in most parts of the region.

In future, Catherine hopes to expand the cereals shop, sell various types of cereals and make more income and be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals such as rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga  in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, flour, rice and other products. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, flour, rice and other products, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and meet customers' needs. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land.

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Faridah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, rice and others products.

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
Valida is 59 years old. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren who are 8 and 10 years old. Valida is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has three milk cows and two calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides, she has a vineyard with 700 samples of vine trees and a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of products are grown. 

Valida sells the harvested products and cheese locally in an open market at a good price. She requested a loan to purchase an additional milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, she will be able to produce and thus to sell more cheese. This will increase the income of the family. 

With another part of the loan, she plans to renovate a bathroom. After the bathroom is renovated they will be able to improve their living conditions. Valida awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and to renovate a bathroom.

loans.name: Ulker

texts.en:
Ulker is a 24-year-old young dealer. She worked selling perfumes in the city of Rostov-na-Donu and she gained a lot experience there about perfumes and beauty goods. About two years ago her parents decided to return home, to improve the family's living conditions and to be useful, one year ago Ulker started her own business. 

Ulker is engaged in in a retail business; she buys women's clothes and perfume and sells them in the district where she lives.

Ulker is a hard worker and a smart young lady, she puts so much effort into increasing her business capital, because she is sure that this will reflect positively on her family's social and financial living standards. Through this loan, she will increase her perfume inventory.

loans.use: To increase her perfume inventory.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is 40 years old and has been married for years, with seven children, three of whom attend school. 

Kabibi has had a grocery store for ten years, thanks to the help from her husband, who works as a fisherman. Together, they help one another with the family expenses and educating her children.

She is asking for this loan to buy noodles, flour, cooking oil, herbs, cookies, cassava, drinks, and candy, among other things, to stock her store, so she can offer a greater variety to her customers and be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, cooking oil, herbs, cookies, cassava, drinks, and candy, among other things, to stock her store.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred  is 44 years old and lives in the town of Seeta, in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Fred has been working hard to manage his small business in which he sells charcoal. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to boost the business and stock more sacks of charcoal and will help Fred to generate greater profits and improve on standards of living. Fred hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand on his business. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Fred, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to boost the business and stock more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed says that, thanks to the previous loan that he received from Kiva, he was able to provide better products to his customers and he was able to grow his business sufficiently. He is very grateful for this support.

Today, he is once again interested in asking for further assistance. He is requesting this loan to buy spare parts and accessories for his motorbike. He is very grateful for the new opportunity that he's receiving since it will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for his motorbike.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. She has been running a general store with the support of her husband for many years. The man shown in the photo is Irshad’s husband.  They offer various grocery items and cleaning products at reasonable prices and have attained a list of regular customers. Irshad wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour to meet with the increasing demand at her store. In this way she will be able to cater her customers time after time. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of providing a quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Mbui

texts.en: Mbui is 34 years old, married and lives with his wife and five children in their home in the town of Samburu. He operates a livestock business buying cows and goats for resale at a profit, a business which he started over 15 years ago. He gained customers over time due to the high quality of his products and now has a solid customer base. He is requesting this loan to buy a balanced diet for his cows, because he relies on them to make a living and to have enough income for his family. He is grateful to Yehu Microfinance because he will be able to buy more food for his cows so that they have a higher production and in this way he can offer more to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more food for his cows

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad is a 43-year-old man, married with two children. He keeps a café and serves people with launch and dinner in his café. He has eight years of experience. He decided to start his own business because his income as foreman was not stable and was very low. Now he runs his business and serves people with daily meals in his café.  

People in Azerbaijan like to have launch in national style cafes and eat national food, as well as spend time with friends in the evening drinking tea with homemade jam. Elshad's place don’t look very attractive, but his food is delicious and that’s why his café is full of people. His older son helps him and cooks in his café. 

His monthly income is 200 AZN and he would like to increase it. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. He will use this loan to renovate his café. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to renovate his café.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga  in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine to sell, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and make more profits. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to increase on the capital. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs (medicine) for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old and married with two children aged nine and five years old. She runs a poultry-rearing business in Tala town. She sells and supplies the chicken and eggs to various hotels and markets in the area and this has been profitable for the past three years.

This being her second loan term,she plans to buy more stock of poultry feed for her poultry. She also plans to buy more chicks to rear and thereby increase her stock of poultry.

Mary hopes to become a large scale poultry farmer, make more income and be able to provide good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of poultry feed and more chicks to rear.

loans.name: Dragan

texts.en:
Dragan is married, and is a father of three children. They live in a minority community in Kosovo. As is traditional, he works in the agricultural business. Dragan started working to address the family's needs, and also he has started to plant vegetables for his family's consumption and to sell to other people in the area. 

His wife is a housewife and sometimes helps her husband when she has free time. Currently, Dragan generates income by planting different vegetables and selling them in the area where he lives. 

Now he is in need of a loan to pay for a new tractor. The loan will help him to grow his business and generate more income. He hopes that, in this way, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. He thanks all of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for a new tractor.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is fifty five years old, married to Jesse and a mother of four children. She owns rental houses, and has been in this business for the past 15 years now. She gets a monthly salary of 42,000 KES. This will be Mercy's second loan with KADET LTD; she plans to use the entire loan to make new roof for her rental houses. In future she wants to be financially stable and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To repair roofs on her rental houses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is from Samburu. He is 49 years old and married. They have two young children who are in school, so both he and his wife strive to get ahead and provide their children with everything they did not have.

Benson has a food pantry in his house. Thanks to the good variety he offers, he has been able to establish a good clientele. He is a hardworking individual and says that he wants to continue growing in his current profession. For this reason, he strives to do his best.

Benson is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the purchase of beverages, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables and other products so that he can continue offering his customers the variety that they are accustomed to having.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, milk, bread, noodles, rice, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is from Samburu. She is 60 years old and a widow with six children, five of whom are adults and work independently, while one still attends school. Fatuma's business is buying, preparing and selling vegetables. She sells to neighboring community members in the town market. She tells us that she has an established customer base, which helps her make a very good income and thereby to help her family. Fatuma is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, including tomatoes, peppers and onions. She tells us that this will enable her to stock up and offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, including tomatoes, peppers and onions, to provide greater variety to her customers.

loans.name: Denise

texts.en: Denise is 33 years old. She is married and has six children. Only four are enrolled in school. She sells sugar, rice and cooking oil. With this loan, she wants to add more rice and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children. She is very happy with her previous loan, which allowed her to pay for her children’s school fees, so that last year none of her children were chased out of class.

loans.use: to buy more rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en: Luvuno is applying for another Kiva loan to buy noodles, flour, various types of oil, cookies, cassava, beverages, sweets, shoes and various kinds of meat to sell in her store. She will thus be able to offer her clients a wider variety, which will result in a higher income. She appreciates the opportunity she has, because it will be useful, not only for her but also for her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, cookies, various types of meat and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Benta

texts.en: Benta is 52 years old and married, and she supports five family members. She runs a retail shop and has been in business for nine years. Her monthly income from the business is KES 72,000. She is borrowing KES 100,000, which she intends to use to add stocks of sugar, cooking fat, bath soap and soda to her shop. This her tenth loan, and she has successfully paid her previous loans well and in good time.

loans.use: to add stocks of sugar, cooking fat, bath soap and soda to her shop.

loans.name: William

texts.es: A william le ha ido muy bien en su negocio de fabricación de calzado y en su pequeña variedad donde vende articulos variados que usualmente la clientela compra al detalle y son una necesidad diaria de las familias. Con su credikiva anterior logró responde con mas producción a la temporada pasada y esto lo ayudó a invertir en su miscelanea. Hoy está muy satisfecho y aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el fondo Kiva con el cual comprará materiales para elaborar nuevos diseños de calzado y  artículos de miscelanea como accesorios, útiles escolares. William da un mensaje a sus financiadores y le pides dice "Agradezco mucho esta oportunidad y espero me apoyen nuevamente"
texts.en:
William has done very well in his shoe-making business and small store where he sells various items that his customers usually buy at retail level and which are a daily necessity for families.  With his previous loan from Kiva, he was able to increase production for the past season, and this helped him to invest in other items.  

Today, he is very satisfied, and is applying for a new loan through Kiva. He will use it to buy to buy materials to make new shoe designs and various items such as accessories and school supplies. William has a message for his lenders: "I am very grateful for this opportunity, and I hope you support me again".

loans.use: to buy materials to make new shoe designs and various items such as accessories, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente, 63, and his wife Juana live in the village of San Jose, in the foothills of the Maya Mountains. They have five children, age 4 to 42, one of who lives in with the family. The older children have jobs in the city and one is also a cacao farmer. 

Vicente started growing cacao 27 years ago with a group of farmers that got a land concession to start cultivating cacao in an agroforestry system, growing cacao among timber trees that provide the necessary nutrients and shade for healthy production. They planted the cacao communally and divided it into parcels once the trees became productive. Cacao trees typically take three to five years to start producing pods, depending on the soil, shade and genetics. Vicente manages a two-acre farm with about 650 trees. 

Farming cacao is a little hard, says Vicente, however he likes that it is a permanent crop with harvest seasons that come and go for many years. The most challenging part of cacao farming is the constant battle with diseases, he says. Cacao farms in southern Belize are subject to monilia, an infectious fungal disease that makes pods black and spreads from its pores. “If you don’t check often, the disease spreads up,” Vicente told Maya Mountain Cacao in English, his second language after his native Maya Mopan. 

In the future, Vicente hopes to expand his farm, something he has been planning but lacking capital to start. Cacao farm expansion requires hard work and time, starting from clearing the land for planting, raising seedlings in bags for six months, lining the land to map out where the plants will go and finally the transplantation into the ground. Moreover, cacao trees take three to five years to become productive, making expansion a long-term investment. For the meanwhile, Vicente is requesting this loan to clean and prune his two acres of cacao. Cleaning means clearing underbrush surrounding cacao trees to clear access to them for pruning and harvesting. Pruning is the process of cutting non-productive branches to increase yields in the coming season.

loans.use: Hire help to clean and prune cacao.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is from the Siznak villagein the Syuniq region of Armenia. She lives with her family, which consists of her husband and two children: Monika (19 years old) and Volodya (18 years old). Ruzanna and her husband work hard to sustain the family and cover its basic needs. Monika studies at the State Engineering University of Armenia of the Syuniq region in the economics department. She is a very purposeful young lady who is working hard to complete her education and become a good specialist. Unfortunately, it is very difficult for Ruzanna and her husband to cover the family's basic needs and, at the same time, save money for Monika's education. So Ruzanna has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition

loans.name: Alisherjon

texts.ru: Алишерджону 34 года. У него жена и четверо детей. Он со своей семьей проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Алишерджон занимается семейным дехканством. У него 0,50га орошаемой земли, где он выращивает овощи, в основном огурцы, помидоры и чеснок. Он занят в этой сфере более 15 лет и является опытным дехканином. Алишерджон сейчас просит кредит для посева овощей (огурцов, помидора и чеснока) и обработки их минеральными удобрениями. За счет прибыли с урожая он хочет расширить свою земледельческую деятельность.
texts.en:
Alisherjon is thirty-four years old. He lives with his wife and four children in Tursun-zoda, Tajikistan. Alisherjon makes a living by growing vegetables like cucumbers, tomatoes and garlic on a 0.5 hectare plot of land. He's been a farmer for 15 years and is very experienced. 

Alisherjon is asking for a loan in order to plant his vegetables and enrich his soil with mineral fertilizers. He wants to use the profits from the loan on expanding his business.

loans.use: to plant vegetables (cucumbers, tomatoes, garlic) and enriching the soil with mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Bibikhursand

texts.ru: Бибихурсанд 53 года. Она с мужем и четырьмя детьми проживает в городе Вахдат. У Бибихурсанд есть собственная ферма, где работает ее муж и она сама. Бибихурсанд совместно с мужем занимается животноводстводческой деятельностью уже 9 лет. Она покупает коров и телят, откармливает их несколько месяцев и затем продает с наценкой на скотном рынке. Сейчас Бибихурсанд намерена расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль.  С этой целью она запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Bibikhursand is fifty-three years old. She lives with her husband and four children in Vahdat, Tajikistan. They own a small farm where they have run a cattle business for the last nine years. 

Bibikhursand buys cows and calves, fattens them for several months and the sells them for profit on a cattle market. Bibikhursand wants to expand her business and generate more profits. Therefore, she's asking for a loan which will enable her to buy more cattle for future sale.

loans.use: to buy and resell large cattle.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La escultura es el arte que practica Irma en su pequeño taller ubicado en el patio de su casa, su esposo trabaja en una galería y le ayuda a vender mucho de lo que produce. Ella pinta biscochos que sirven para adornar los interiores de las viviendas y los vende a crédito, a una clientela que ha construido poco a apoco desde que inició su negocio. Su aspiración de crecimiento no cesa pero debe mejorar las condiciones de trabajo, porque afectan a su familia, por eso está acudiendo a un primer financiamiento de Kiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque adecuará su taller en un espacio delantero de su casa y con ello se notará el cambio en el sosiego de su hogar. Su meta es tener un punto comercial en un lugar especializado donde converjan en la oferta arte y artista, para que en la ciudad quede posicionado un lugar donde comprar toda las esculturas y trabajos artísticos, que no solo ella fabrica con sus propias manos, sino que son el producto del trabajo de un gran número de artistas que no se detienen y necesitan ser apoyados en el mercado.
texts.en:
Irma makes sculptures in her small workshop located in the garden of her home. Her husband works in a gallery and helps her to sell a lot of what she makes. She paints ceramic objects which decorate home interiors and sells them on credit to a customer base that she has created little by little since beginning her business. She still dreams of growing, but she needs to improve working conditions, because they affect her family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to move her workshop to a space behind the house. Through doing this, she will see a difference in her family's peace of mind.

Her aim is to have a trading post in a special place where art and the artist converge, so that there is a place in the city where you can buy all the different sculptures and art on offer, not only those that she makes but that are the work of a large number of artists who do not stop and who need support in the market.

loans.use: investing in adjusting her workshop.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Нуриддину 37 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Нуриддин со своей семьей проживает в городе Вахдат. Он зарабатывает на жизнь работая продавцом. В центральном рынке своего города Нуриддин имеет магазин, где продает продукты питания и фрукты. Он занимается торговой деятельностью более 8 лет. Нуриддин предприимчивый и целеустремленный человек. Он хочет увеличить товарооборот и для этого обратился в организацию за кредитом. Он берет кредит для приобретения ассортимента товара - фруктов и продуктов питания в свой магазин и за счет прибыли с продажи расширить свою торговую деятельность.
texts.en:
Nuriddin is thirty-seven years old. He lives with his wife and three children in Vahdat, Tajikistan. He makes a living as a salesman. Nuriddin owns a shop on the city's central market where he sells various foods. He's very entrepreneurial and dedicated and he's run this business for the past eight years. 

Nuriddin wants to increase his goods turnover and, hence, is asking for a loan. This loan will enable him to buy a variety of goods for his shop like fruits and groceries, while the profits from selling these goods will allow him to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goods for his store, increase turnover and expand his business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been successfully selling assorted goods for the past four years. He now earns a monthly income of 14,000 KES. He intends to use the loan to purchase more watches, sandals, sunglasses and torches.

With the anticipated profits, he will open a retail shop. His hopes and dreams are to own his own rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase more watches, sandals, sunglasses and torches.

loans.name: Magdana

texts.en: Magdana is 33 years old. She lives in Khobi district with her husband Tornike, mother-in-law and two children who are going to school. The family owns three milk cows, a calf and a pig. She milks the cows to make cheese. The family also owns an agricultural plot of land where they grow nut trees and sow maize. Tornike harvests products to sell with the cheese locally at the markets. They get a small monthly income which is not enough to feed a five-member family. Magdana plans to purchase a tractor with the requested loan. Her husband Tornike will use it to till their plot, and this will reduce tilling costs. He will also use the tractor on neighbors’ plots and get additional income. Magdana plans to reinvest the profit in her agricultural activities as well as improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has serviced his previous loan for farm input well and his monthly income from the business is now KES 50,000.

He is now borrowing a loan of KES 80,000 with which he wants to buy fertilizer and seeds. He plans to enhance his farming with the profits anticipated. This is his third loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer in preparation for the planting season.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, from Samburu, is the owner of a pharmacy, in a good location, with a well-formed client base. She is a very hard-working, responsible, and honest person. She strives every day to be able to get ahead and reach her goals.

According to her, she started working in a home pharmacy as a sales person. Her dream was to have a mini-pharmacy, to start working independently. With the passing of time, with her own effort and the help of her husband, she was able to get her pharmacy. She states that she obtained many clients which motivated her to keep working this way, to be able to make her dream a reality. Since then, she has expanded her business premises and bought more pharmaceutical products.

She is requesting this loan to purchase medicines, to be able to continue producing for her customers and giving them better products, always.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy is 50 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has six children - four of whom are currently in school. For the past 18 years, Cathy has been working hard to manage her small local hotel which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Cathy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more inputs for her business and to buy more chairs for her small local hotel thereby helping Cathy to generate greater profits and therefore generate income. Cathy hopes that in the future she will be able to pay tuition for her children. 

Cathy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Cathy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more inputs and more chairs for her small local hotel.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en:
Lucie is 33 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has spent ten years in the business. 

She wants the loan to upgrade her business by adding more corn, beans, and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy more corn, beans, and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth is 50 years old. She sells beans and cassava. She has been in the business for 12 years. 

She wants the loan to buy more beans and cassava to sell. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beans and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Odule

texts.en:
Odule is 40 years old. She sells foodstuffs and other items in her boutique, for which she has developed an idea of adding more items, such as cooking oil and beans. She has spent four years in this business. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more cooking oil and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy beans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en: Aloys is 36 years old. He is married with six children. With the loan, he wants to buy more beans, corn and sorghum for resale. He is planning to use the profits to pay his children's school fees. He is very blessed to have gotten the loan that he did, and he says he is very thankful for Kiva for the loans provided. The loans have transformed his life and his family. He has managed to upgrade his business by buying and selling more products, going from selling 1.5 tonnes to 5 tonnes of sorghum.

loans.use: to buy more beans, corn and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Ngombe

texts.en:
Ngombe is from Samburu. She is 45 years old, widowed, and has seven children: six grown children who work independently and one who attends school. She has a fruit and vegetable stand at Samburu market. Thanks to the high quality of products that she offers, she has been able to establish a good customer base and earn a good income. She says that she strives to move forward so that she can generate a little more income and have a retirement that is problem-free.

Ngombe is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits such as melons, watermelons and grapes; and other products so that she can restock her inventory and meet the demand of her customers. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits such as melons, watermelons and grapes; and other products for her fruit and vegetable stand.

loans.name: Evanis

texts.en: Evanis aged 22. She is married to a tailor and they have one child. She sells fabrics and has spent five years in this business. She is borrowing money to buy more fabrics for sale and wants to renovate the house from the profits.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 36 years old. She has been married for five years. With this loan, she wants to add more products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and juice to her inventory for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Petronille

texts.en: Petronille is 35 years old. She is married with four children.  She sells timber and has spent 10 years in this business. The profits from the business will be used to save money for making her business better in the future.

loans.use: to buy more timber for sale.

loans.name: Nellys

texts.es: Nellys además de los ingresos de su esposo, cuenta para su hogar con sus propios ingresos y estos los ha fortalecido con su credikiva, pues recibió previamente uno, con el cual logró hacer compras de muchos más insumos, para producir y vender un poco más de bolsos y sandalias artesanales. En la actualidad se prepara a recibir un nuevo financiamiento, con el cual comprará materias primas,  fabricará nuevos diseños de bolsos y aumentará sus ventas impactando cada vez a mas clientes. Esto es lo que hace que su credikiva sea muy exitoso, pues Nelly dice que gracias a Kiva ha logrado ayudar a su familia especialmente a su hijos y en la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Nellys, in addition to her husband's income, earns her own income for the household. She has increased this through her credikiva loan. She received one previously, with which she managed to purchase many more supplies for producing and selling a few more bags and hand-crafted sandals. 

Now she is she is getting ready to receive a new loan, with which she will buy raw materials. She will make new bag designs and add to her sales by attracting more and more customers. This is what makes her credikiva loan very successful. 

Nelly says that thanks to Kiva, she has succeeded in helping her family, especially her children, and has helped with her household's finances.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for making handbags.

loans.name: Chinyavi

texts.en:
Chinyavi says thanks to Kiva for the previous loan that she received. Because of it, she was able to provide better products to her customers, and she was able to grow her business sufficiently. She is very grateful for this support.

She once again asks for further assistance. She wants to invest in her store again - to be able to stock it with more products and packets of milk. She is very grateful for the new opportunity that she is receiving as it will a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase packets of milk.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 27 years old. She is married and blessed with three children between the ages of one and five. With the loan, she wants to buy more beer and soda for sale. With the profits from the business, she wants to buy a cow which will provide milk for the family.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, who used his previous loan to buy sugar to sell, is a 31-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for the last three years, and with the income earned he has been able to restock his business and pay school fees. His main hardship is high taxes.

Nevertheless, Richard intends to work hard to attain his goal of expanding his business into new markets and buying land to grow crops. He is now requesting a loan to buy maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 31 years old. She is married and has five children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for six years. She has requested this loan to buy beans and sorghum for resale. The profits from this business will be used to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Frasia

texts.en: Flasia is 31 years old. She is married and has three children who all go to school. With the loan, she wants to add more beer to her pub. The profits will be used to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en: Zurab is 32 years old from Zestaponi district. He is married and lives with his wife, two infant children, mother and grandmother (who is provided with a retirement pension). The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have two milk cows and two calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. They also have a vineyard with 800 samples of vine trees and a 0.8 hectare plot of agricultural land. Zurab requested a loan for house renovation. After their house is renovated, they will be able to live in better conditions. Zurab awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Libertad 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Bernarda is the coordinator of her group, Libertad (Liberty). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and one child. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to finish building her house. She enjoys being with her family.

This is Bernarda's ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and growing her business. She has been running her business for around five years, after she decided to run a small business from her house. She started selling groceries and she is now running a clothing sales business and also has motorcycles for rent. This loan will be used to buy clothes for her clothing sales business. She will use the profits to reinvest in her house. She is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Karungule Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Eurelia is a 42-year-old married woman with 6 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a member of a village group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. She is a market vendor who sells children’s clothes. This is a business that she has been operating for 4 years along busy streets. She is also a farmer who grows maize and beans, and this is her primary income activity. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations affect her business. Her dream is to venture into commercialized agriculture. Eurelia intends to use the loan to pay workers who are helping her in preparing the land ahead of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for workers who are helping her in preparing the land ahead of the planting season.

loans.name: Kasanga Thuyikulhaye Group

texts.en: Goret is a forty-five-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. For ten years now, she has been operating a retail shop. She started this business to supplement her farming activities. As the good mother that she is, she wants to educate her children so that they have degrees as a minimum qualification, even though she never had a chance to further her education herself due to the low level of her parents' income. Price fluctuation and high license fees affect her business plan. Her dream is to have a wholesale shop. She is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. Goret intends to use the loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Jacent

texts.en:
Jacent is 36 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children; two of whom are currently in school. For the past 4 years, Jacent has been working hard to manage her bar and restaurant, which sells soft drinks and wines. 

To help expand her business, Jacent has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beer, wine and other drinks for her business, and will help her to generate greater profits, boost the business and increase her income. Jacent hopes that in the future she will be able to build a bigger place for the hotel. 

Jacent is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jacent who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.
